widgets_values: blurry, out of focus, overexposed, underexposed, low contrast, washed out colors, excessive noise, grainy texture, poor lighting, flickering, motion blur, distorted proportions, unnatural skin tones, deformed facial features, asymmetrical face, missing facial features, extra limbs, disfigured hands, wrong hand count, artifacts around text, unreadable text on shirt or hat, incorrect lettering on cap (“PNTR”), incorrect t-shirt slogan (“JUST DO IT”), missing microphone, misplaced microphone, inconsistent perspective, camera shake, incorrect depth of field, background too sharp, background clutter, distracting reflections, harsh shadows, inconsistent lighting direction, color banding, cartoonish rendering, 3D CGI look, unrealistic materials, uncanny valley effect, incorrect ethnicity, wrong gender, exaggerated expressions, smiling, laughing, exaggerated sadness, wrong gaze direction, eyes looking at camera, mismatched lip sync, silent or muted audio, distorted voice, robotic voice, echo, background noise, off-sync audio, missing sniff sounds, incorrect dialogue, added dialogue, repetitive speech, jittery movement, awkward pauses, incorrect timing, unnatural transitions, inconsistent framing, tilted camera, missing door or shelves, missing shallow depth of field, flat lighting, inconsistent tone, cinematic oversaturation, stylized filters, or AI artifacts.

nodes.title: LoRA
widgets_values:
# Using LoRAs
**Ctrl + B to enable**

For the camera LoRA we recommend setting strength = 1

You can use LTX [Ready to use camera LoRAs](https://huggingface.co/collections/Lightricks/ltx-2)




Use a second LoRa only when the details are important in the LoRa. 

## Training
We have made available a full trainer to help you to train your own LoRA. You can [find it here](https://github.com/Lightricks/LTX-2).

nodes.title: Download and put static camera LORA here
Load Latent Upscale Model - Put LTX Upscale model here
6. Set Audio File Start Index (in seconds)
Preview Image and Resolution for final Video
Model Links
widgets_values:
START HERE:

This LTX-2 workflow allows you to add an existing audio file with dialogue or music with vocals and an image to generate a video that lipsyncs to that audio. It works with both realistic and animated/cartoon images and was designed to use the 19b dev FP8 (NOT DISTILLED) model that is linked below. To save memory, I've set this up with the quantized gemma - also linked below.


## Model links (for local users)

**checkpoints**

- [ltx-2-19b-dev-fp8.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Lightricks/LTX-2/resolve/main/ltx-2-19b-dev-fp8.safetensors)

**text_encoders - Quantized Gemma

- [gemma_3_12B_it_fp8_e4m3fn.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/GitMylo/LTX-2-comfy_gemma_fp8_e4m3fn/resolve/main/gemma_3_12B_it_fp8_e4m3fn.safetensors?download=true)

**loras**

I have default set the distilled lora to .6 strength because higher values affect quality on realistic people images. Changing it to higher may help animated/CGI images, but it definitely seems to work well at .6 for realistic.

- [LTX-2-19b-LoRA-Camera-Control-Static](https://huggingface.co/Lightricks/LTX-2-19b-LoRA-Camera-Control-Static/resolve/main/ltx-2-19b-lora-camera-control-static.safetensors?download=true)

- [ltx-2-19b-distilled-lora-384.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Lightricks/LTX-2/resolve/main/ltx-2-19b-distilled-lora-384.safetensors)

**latent_upscale_models**

- [ltx-2-spatial-upscaler-x2-1.0.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Lightricks/LTX-2/resolve/main/ltx-2-spatial-upscaler-x2-1.0.safetensors)


Mel-Band RoFormer Model - For Audio

- [MelBandRoformer_fp32.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Kijai/MelBandRoFormer_comfy/resolve/main/MelBandRoformer_fp32.safetensors?download=true)


Model Storage Location

```
📂 ComfyUI/
├── 📂 models/
│   ├── 📂 checkpoints/
│   │      └── ltx-2-19b-dev-fp8.safetensors
│   │      └── MelBandRoformer_fp32.safetensors
│   ├── 📂 text_encoders/
│   │      └── gemma_3_12B_it.safetensors
│   ├── 📂 loras/
│   │      ├── LTX-2-19b-LoRA-Camera-Control-Static
│   │      └── ltx-2-19b-distilled-lora-384.safetensors
│   └── 📂 latent_upscale_models/
│          └── ltx-2-spatial-upscaler-x2-1.0.safetensors
```

Usage:

Load all the models and Loras. I strongly recommend you download and use the Camera-Control-Static lora because it will fix no motion/still video issues with portrait images (length greater than height). Use "Static Camera" in the prompt and set strength to 1.

Follow steps 1-7 in the group on the right (look at the title bars for each node. 

1. Load Image
2. Set the width and height in resize node. That will set the width and height of the video. The preview will show you the actual dimensions since it will "resize" and auto calculate so the width and height are both divisible by 32
3. Choose Seed (random or fixed)
4. Load Audio File - I recommend MP3 format, but other formats may work depending on the loader.
5. Set the length of the video in frame. Alternatively, you can have frames auto calculate from the sound file duration node in step 7 if you connect up the math node to the "set frames" node. See brown note by that node.
6. Set Audio file start index. If your audio isn't trimmed precisely or is a long clip, you can tell it to start at X seconds in with this node. 
7. Set the audio length. If you set this, but don't set the video frames long enough, the sound will get cut off.  



On a 4090 system with 24gb VRAM and 64gb CPU RAM, I'm able to generate 20 seconds of video at 768 x 1152 in about 6-8 min using ComfyUI version v 0.9.1 (latest stable).

Starting out, I would try 480 x 832 (portrait) or 832 x 480 (widescreen) at 5 sec, see how your system does at 10s, 15s, 20s and then try increasing resolution until you hit your sweet spot for length and resolution.

You can actually disable the Upscale node using the "Fast Group Bypasser" node if you want to "preview" a seed, prompt, and image. I recommend using "New Fixed Random" on the seed (rgthree) node. When you get a good generation, you can immediately re-enable that node and it will go through the upscale process supposedly referring to cache for the first part which will save time.

***Important note about "video quality": The upscale node has a lora called ltx-2-19b-distilled-lora-384.safetensors. Setting the strength of this to 1 will give you very waxy skin and other artifacts on "realistic" people images. In this workflow I have set the default to .6    You can experiment with this value and set it to whatever you like, just realize this will affect quality. A higher number may work better for animated or CGI images and might also affect other things like speed, I can't say for sure. str=.6 is definitely better for people in my opinion. There is also an optional "add detail" lora in the upscale node. I have it disabled by default. If you enable it, I recommend setting it to .3 for realistic characters, but play around with it to suit your taste as well. Remember adding more LORAs consumes more resources. I have a video showing a comparison in my profile:

https://reddit.com/u/dohwar42

nodes.title: 2. Set Width and Height of Video

widgets_values:
Connect the INT (integer) from the node on the left to the "Set_frames" node above if you want to use the audio duration to automatically calculate the needed video length. 

When you connect the node, it will take the audio and multiply it by 24 and then add 1 to get the frame count of the video. OR leave the step 5. Frames length on manual if you have a short audio clip, but want a longer video.

nodes.title: 8. Put in a Prompt for other actions.
widgets_values: She is in deeply expressive speaking motion. She is looking directly at the camera, with natural, intermittent eye blinks and subtle shifts in her gaze maintaining a natural connection with the viewer. Her head moves with gentle, expressive nods and tilts that align with her speech. Her hands make intense conversant occasional, deliberate, purposeful gestures to fully emphasize her points. The camera is static and at eye level. Soft, professional lighting highlights her features. 8K, hyperrealistic. Static camera Shot.

nodes.title: 5. Set Frames Vid length (24 frames=1 second)
4. Load Audio File here - recommend MP3

groups.title: Model - Set Checkpoint and Encoder Model HERE
Camera LoRAs (Ctrl-B to enable) - Setup Static Camera LORA and optional Detail Lora for upscale
Audio - Download MelBandfomer model and load it here.
Setup all models and Loras - Then follow Steps 1 -7
